original_text:
Big Bang (Belatra Games)
Fai un viaggio tra pianeti galleggianti, stelle cadenti e satelliti con Big Bang, la slot Belatra Games con sistema a cascata e tantissime combinazioni vincenti
Un volo tra le stelle
Giocare a Big Bang, la nuova slot Belatra Game, è come fare un viaggio per il cosmo. Il tema è naturalmente lo spazio, anche se un po’ diverso da come lo conosciamo. Ci troviamo infatti su un pianeta desertico, con la griglia di gioco sistemata nell’incavo di una roccia mentre sullo sfondo abbiamo rocce sospese a mezz’aria in un cielo notturno da cui cadono stelle verticali.
La componente grafica è di ottima fattura, i colori sono brillanti e i simboli disegnati benissimo. I tasti principali, di grandi dimensioni, sono posizionati in basso, mentre quelli per le impostazioni secondarie sono più piccoli e si trovano in alto a sinistra, così da lasciare ampio spazio alla griglia di gioco.
Caratteristiche di Big Bang
La griglia di gioco ha forma quadrata, con 8 bobine e 8 file e una vincita massima di 5.000 volte la puntata in una singola partita. Il sistema è a cluster, ciò vuol dire che le combinazioni vincenti non devono essere per forza lineari, a anche per gruppi. Ogni combinazione vincente attiva poi il classico meccanismo a cascata, per cui i simboli paganti vengono rimossi e sostituiti da altri del tutto nuovi.
Il gioco può essere settato attraverso alcune funzioni come l’Autoplay e la funzione Turbo, che accelera la caduta dei simboli rendendo il gioco più veloce.
Il ritorno teorico al giocatore è del 96,11 %, mentre la volatilità è media.
Un Wild/Scatter speciale
In Big Bang ci sono solo sei simboli tutti tematici. Per intenderci, non troverete le classiche carte da gioco che ci sono in quasi tutte le slot, ma solo astri e pianeti: Terra, Marte, Venere, Nettuno, la luna, il sole.
Per vincere è necessario creare cluster di almeno 5 simboli sino a 25 e più.
Il simbolo speciale è il buco nero che è sia Wild che Scatter. Nel primo caso, sostituisce tutti gli altri simboli ed è accompagnato da un moltiplicatore, inizialmente x1. A seguito di una combo vincente, prima che cadano gli altri nuovi simboli, il Wild si sposterà in una postazione libera e aumenterà di x1 il moltiplicatore. Se ci sono più Wild, i moltiplicatori relativi vengono moltiplicati tra di loro. Quando più buchi neri sono adiacenti, si formerà un unico grande Wild di dimensioni 2×2 o 3×3. A seguito della combo vincente, il simbolo grande si divide in simboli più piccoli che occuperanno le posizione liberate dai simboli paganti. Simboli dei pianeti più grandi possono verificarsi in modo casuale o quando si attiva la funzione Pioggia dei Pianeti.
Il buco nero nella sua funzione di Scatteda diritto a tre Free Spins quando compare per tre volte; durante i giri gratuiti il simbolo speciale rimarrà sullo schermo sino alla conclusione del gioco bonus.

Domande Frequenti 
Qual è la volatilità di Big Bang?

La volatilità è media, con un ottimo bilanciamento tra frequenza delle giocate e somme elargite. Ciò vuol dire che si vincono cifre né alte né basse con una buona frequenza.



Posso giocare a Big Bang dal tablet?

Assolutamente sì, questo gioco è creato con architettura HTML5, adatta per qualsiasi dispositivo portatile.



Posso provare il gioco senza spendere soldi?

Certo, sul nostro sito viene offerta la possibilità di testare Big Bang in modalità Demo totalmente gratuita.

raw_translation.response:
Big Bang (Belatra Games)
Take a journey among floating planets, falling stars, and satellites with Big Bang, the Belatra Games slot with a cascade system and countless winning combinations.

A Flight Among The Stars
Playing Big Bang, the new Belatra Game slot, is like taking a journey through the cosmos. The theme is naturally space, although a bit different from what we know. We find ourselves on a desert planet, with the game grid set into a rock crevice while in the background we have rocks suspended in mid-air in a night sky from which vertical stars fall.
The graphics are of high quality, with bright colors and well-drawn symbols. The main keys, of large size, are located at the bottom, while the secondary settings keys are smaller and are located in the upper left, leaving ample space for the game grid.

Features of Big Bang
The game grid is square, with 8 reels and 8 rows and a maximum win of 5,000 times the bet in a single game. The system is cluster-based, meaning that winning combinations don't have to be linear, but can also be in groups. Each winning combination then activates the classic cascading mechanism, whereby paying symbols are removed and replaced by entirely new ones.
The game can be set through some functions such as Autoplay and Turbo function, which accelerates the fall of symbols making the game faster.
The theoretical return to player is 96.11%, while the volatility is medium.

A Special Wild/Scatter
In Big Bang there are only six thematic symbols. To be clear, you will not find the classic playing cards that are in almost all slots, but only stars and planets: Earth, Mars, Venus, Neptune, the moon, and the sun.
To win, it is necessary to create clusters of at least 5 symbols up to 25 and more.
The special symbol is the black hole which is both Wild and Scatter. In the first case, it replaces all other symbols and is accompanied by a multiplier, initially x1. After a winning combo, before the new symbols fall, the Wild will move to a free position and increase the multiplier by x1. If there are multiple Wilds, their relative multipliers are multiplied together. When multiple black holes are adjacent, a single large Wild of size 2×2 or 3×3 will form. Following the winning combo, the large symbol will divide into smaller symbols that will occupy the positions freed up by the paying symbols. Larger planet symbols can occur randomly or when the Planet Rain feature is activated.
The black hole in its Scatter function entitles you to three Free Spins when it appears three times; during free spins the special symbol will remain on the screen until the bonus game is over.

Frequently Asked Questions
What is the volatility of Big Bang?
The volatility is medium, with an excellent balance between the frequency of plays and the amounts paid out. This means that you win neither high nor low amounts with a good frequency.

Can I play Big Bang on a tablet?
Absolutely yes, this game is created with HTML5 architecture, suitable for any portable device.

Can I try the game without spending money?
Certainly, on our website, you have the opportunity to test Big Bang in Demo mode completely free.

response.headline: Exploring the Special Symbols in Big Bang
response.content:
Hold on to your spacesuits, folks, because Big Bang offers some truly out-of-this-world special symbols that are sure to keep you on the edge of your seat.

First off, we have the black hole - a powerful and mysterious force that serves as both a Wild and a Scatter symbol. Talk about multitasking! Not only does it replace all other symbols on the reels, but it also starts off with a humble x1 multiplier. However, things start to get interesting after a winning combo - the black hole will move to a free position and increase its multiplier by another x1. And with multiple wilds in play, their relative multipliers will be multiplied together. That's enough to make your head spin faster than a neutron star!

But that's not all - adjacent black holes can combine to create a single massive wild symbol that's either 2x2 or 3x3 in size. When this happens, the larger symbol splits into smaller ones that fill the empty positions left by the paying symbols. It's like watching a space spectacle unfold right before your eyes!

If you're lucky, you might also encounter some larger planet symbols that can randomly appear on the reels, or be triggered by the Planet Rain function. These cosmic behemoths can really boost your winnings, so keep your eyes peeled for them!

Finally, we have the black hole in its Scatter function. If you manage to land three of them on the reels, you'll earn three Free Spins. During the bonus game, the special symbol will remain on the screen until the very end, so you can rack up some serious winnings. Just be careful not to get sucked into the black hole's gravitational pull!

Review:
 
Gameplay Features

Big Bang is a Belatra Games slot that boasts an impressive cascade system, with a cluster pay feature. The playing grid is 8 reels by 8 rows and has a maximum win of 5,000 times the bet in a single round. The game can be played using various settings such as Autoplay and Turbo mode, which speeds up the pace of play. The theoretical return to the player is 96.11%, while the volatility is medium.

Theme and Visuals

Big Bang's theme is space, featuring floating planets, shooting stars, and satellites which transport players to a desert planet where the playing grid is set in a rock hollow while rocks are suspended in mid-air against a night sky from which vertical stars fall. The graphics are excellent, with bright colors and well-designed symbols. The main buttons are positioned at the bottom of the screen, while secondary settings are located at the top left, leaving ample space for the playing grid.

Special Symbols

Big Bang has only six thematic symbols, featuring the planets Earth, Mars, Venus, Neptune, the moon, and the sun. Players can win by creating clusters of at least 5 symbols, up to 25 or more. The black hole is a special symbol in this game, which acts as both Wild and Scatter. It replaces all other symbols and is accompanied by a multiplier, initially x1. Following a winning combo, the Wild will move to a free position and increase the multiplier by x1. If there are multiple wilds, the relative multipliers are multiplied together. When multiple black holes are adjacent, a single large Wild of size 2×2 or 3×3 is formed. Larger planet symbols can occur randomly or when the Planet Rain function is activated. In its Scatter function, the black hole triggers three Free Spins when it appears three times; during the free spins, the special symbol will remain on the screen until the end of the bonus game.

Winning Combinations

To win in Big Bang, players need to create clusters of at least 5 symbols up to 25 or more. The cascade mechanism means that winning combinations do not have to be linear but can also be in groups. Each winning combination then activates the classic cascade mechanism, whereby paying symbols are removed and replaced by entirely new ones. Players can win up to 5,000 times the bet in a single round when playing Big Bang.

Return to Player

The theoretical return to player (RTP) for Big Bang is 96.11%, which is a decent percentage, ensuring that players get a fair chance to win their bets with good frequency. The game's volatility is medium, meaning that players can expect to have a balanced gaming experience, with neither high nor low amounts won with good frequency.

To win, it is necessary to create clusters of at least 5 symbols up to 25 and more.

The special symbol is the black hole, which is both Wild and Scatter. In the first case, it replaces all other symbols and is accompanied by a multiplier, initially x1. Following a winning combo, before the other new symbols fall, the Wild will move to a free position and increase the multiplier by x1. If there are multiple wilds, the relative multipliers are multiplied together. When multiple black holes are adjacent, a single large Wild of size 2×2 or 3×3 will be formed. Following the winning combo, the large symbol divides into smaller symbols that will occupy the positions freed by the paying symbols. Larger planet symbols can occur randomly or when the Planet Rain function is activated.

The black hole in its Scatter function earns three Free Spins when it appears three times; during the free spins, the special symbol will remain on the screen until the end of the bonus game.

FAQ

What is the volatility of Big Bang?

The volatility is medium, with an excellent balance between the frequency of plays and sums awarded. This means that you win neither high nor low amounts with good frequency.

Can I play Big Bang on a tablet?

Absolutely yes, this game is created with HTML5 architecture, suitable for any portable device.

Can I try the game without spending money?

Of course, on our website, you are offered the possibility to test Big Bang in Demo mode entirely free of charge.
